page.title: 19LOW GREEN CATTERICK
page.content: Low Green is the hub of the village. The beck is a great attraction to children who paddle and fish there. There are stepping stones leading across the beck, ideal for childhood games. The large green has had several smaller ones severed from it and one of these has become known as the Memorial Green as a stone cross stands there in memory of those who gave their lives in the world wars. The large green is constantly in use. Children use it as a football and cricket pitch, twice a year a travelling showman errects swings and roundabouts, but the main event of the year is the St Anne's Church fete when every organization in the village participates. The highlight of the day is the maypole dance performed by the village school children.
